intro: Corydalis kingii var. minuticalcarata, commonly known as the dwarf horned corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically range in color from pink to purple. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in shaded woodland areas. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
